III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Youth A was assaulted by unknown staff while at
the facility.
Investigation On 6/3/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. No additional information
was provided.
On 6/4/24, I spoke to Complainant 1. No additional information
was provided.
Youth A is no longer at the facility. Youth A was placed at the
facility from 2/3/23-5/9/24. Attempts were made to contact Youth A
on 6/5/24, 6/24/24, and 8/1/24 with no avail.
The following interviews were conducted at the facility on 6/5/24:
Administrator 2 reported Youth A never told her that he was hurt
by staff and did not have any grievances filed.
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, and Staff 1 all reported they were
employed at the facility when Youth A was present. All reported
they worked directly with Youth A. All reported they never
witnessed any staff hurt Youth A. All reported Youth A never told
them that any staff hurt him either.
Therapist 1 reported she was the therapist for Youth A. Therapist
1 reported Youth A never mentioned to her that any staff hurt him.
Therapist 1 reported Youth A had a hard time accepting write-ups
and discipline.
Staff 2 was contacted via telephone on 6/24/24 and reported
Youth A had “outbursts” often but was a good kid. Staff 2 reported
2

he has never witnessed any staff hurt Youth A and Youth A never
reported to him that any staff hurt him.
Documents Reviewed:
• All incident reports for Youth A were reviewed. There were
no incident reports that noted staff hurt him.
• There were no grievances in Youth A’s file.
• I reviewed the behavior management policy for the agency,
which prohibits physical punishment.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate the allegations. The agency is in
compliance with this rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
